info.title: Voucherify API
info.description: Voucherify promotion engine REST API. Please see https://docs.voucherify.io/docs for more details.
info.summary: Voucherify is an API-first promotion engine

audienceRulesOnly.name: audienceRulesOnly
audienceRulesOnly.description: This parameter set to true will ask only for verifying vouchers' validation rules only against conditions applied to audiences' attributes (belonging into segment and Customer metadata)

order.name: order
order.description: Sorts the results using one of the filtering options, where the dash `-` preceding a sorting option means sorting in a descending order.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100 items.

campaignId.name: campaignId
campaignId.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the campaign.

page.name: page
page.description: Which page of results to return.

category.name: category
category.description: Limit search results to vouchers within the specified category.

campaignid_.name: campaignid
campaignid_.description: Limit search results to vouchers within the specified campaign

customer.name: customer
customer.description: A tracking identifier of a customer who is the holder of the vouchers. It can be an `id` generated by Voucherify or the `source_id`. Remember to use the proper URL escape codes if the `source_id` contains special characters.

campaign.name: campaign
campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the parent campaign.

created_at.name: created_at

before.description: Timestamp representing the date and time before the voucher was created in ISO 8601 format.

after.description: Timestamp representing the date and time after the voucher was created in ISO 8601 format.

created_at.description: A filter on the list based on the object `created_at` field. The value is a dictionary with the following options: `before`, `after`. A date value must be presented in ISO 8601 format (`2016-11-16T14:14:31Z` or `2016-11-16`). An example: `[created_at][before]=2017-09-08T13:52:18.227Z`

updated_at.name: updated_at

before.description: Timestamp representing the date and time before the voucher was updated in ISO 8601 format.

after.description: Timestamp representing the date and time after the voucher was updated in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: A filter on the list based on the object `updated_at` field. The value is a dictionary with the following options: `before`, `after`. A date value must be presented in ISO 8601 format (`2016-11-16T14:14:31Z` or `2016-11-16`). An example: `[updated_at][before]=2017-09-08T13:52:18.227Z`

campaign_id.name: campaign_id
campaign_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the campaign.

campaign_type.name: campaign_type
campaign_type.description: This attribute allows filtering by campaign type.

Origin.name: Origin
Origin.description: Indicates the origin (scheme, hostname, and port).

session2.name: session
session2.description: The session object required to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests.

session.name: session

schema.description: Schema model for `session` lock object. The session object is **required** to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests. If you only send the `type` parameter in the request, then by default the session lock will be established for 7 days. Read more on establishing a [validation session](docs/validations/Validation-Session.md).

type.description: This parameter is **required** to establish a new session. The session locks the redemption **quantity** by 1 and addtionally the redemption **gift credits** specified within the request for a gift card and the **loyalty points** for a loyalty card.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID. Sending an existing ID will result in overwriting an existing session. If no session key is provided, then a new ID will be generated.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by the `session.ttl_unit` parameter.

session.description: The session object required to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests.

metadata.name: metadata
metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send to check against vouchers requiring **redemption** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The validation runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Advanced_ → _Redemption metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _REDEMPTION METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

1_obj_voucher_object.title: Voucher Object
1_obj_voucher_object.description: This is an object representing a voucher.

examples.additional_info: This voucher discount is based on a formula, payment must be using VISA, and order must be over $100.

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher.

code.description: A code that identifies a voucher. Pattern can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters.

campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

campaign_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

category_id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Defines the type of voucher.

discount.description:
Object representing discount parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `DISCOUNT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`. Type of discount:
- `AMOUNT`
- `PERCENT`
- `UNIT`
- `FIXED`

 A Free Shipping discount is a special instance of the  `UNIT` type discount.

gift.description: Object representing gift parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `GIFT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`.

amount.description: Total gift card income over the lifetime of the card. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

balance.description: Available funds. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order.

loyalty_card.description: Object representing loyalty card parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `LOYALTY_CARD`. Defaults to `null`.

points.description: Total points incurred over lifespan of loyalty card.

next_expiration_date.description: The next closest date when the next set of points are due to expire.

next_expiration_points.description: The amount of points that are set to expire next.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the code starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the code expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the voucher is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the voucher will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a voucher with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a voucher with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the voucher is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

assets.description: Stores links to images of QR and barcode that correspond to an encrypted voucher code.

qr.description: Stores Quick Response (QR) representation of encrypted code.

id.description: Encrypted voucher code ID.

url.description:
URL to QR code  

*Optional:* Attach query parameters to base URL to customize the image of the encrypted voucher code.  

- `size`: integer value from `1` to `100`  
- `format`: string, either `png` (default) or `svg`

barcode.description: Stores barcode representation of encrypted code.

id.description: Encrypted voucher code ID.

url.description:
URL to barcode  

*Optional:* Attach query parameters to base URL to customize the image of the encrypted voucher code.  

- `size`: integer value from `1` to `100`  
- `format`: string, either `png` (default) or `svg`

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

holder_id.description: Unique customer ID of voucher owner.

validation_rules_assignments.description: Stores information about validation rules assigned to the voucher.

object.description: The type of object represented is by default `list`.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of validation rule assignments.

data.description: Array of validation rule assignment objects. Each validation rule assignment object contains details about the rule.

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the validation rule assignment.

rule_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the validation rule.

related_object_id.description: ID of the object from which the rule originates, can be the ID of the `voucher` itself or its parent `campaign`.

related_object_type.description: Which object does the rule originate from: the  `voucher` itself or inherited from its parent `campaign`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the validation rule was created in ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of resource represented by the object.

total.description: Total number of validation rules assigned to the voucher.

redemption.description: Stores a summary of redemptions that have been applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

redeemed_quantity.description: How many times a voucher has already been redeemed.

redeemed_amount.description: Total amount redeemed. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 balance is written as 10000.

object.description: The type of object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the url attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of redemptions can be accessed using a GET method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/redemptions`

publish.description:
This object stores a summary of publish events: an events counter and an endpoint which can be called to return details of each event.  A publication is required for loyalty cards and referral codes. This object gets updated whenever a voucher has been published. Publication means assigning a code to a particular customer. Typically, a publication is made by distributing your codes to your customers, e.g. through Export to MailChimp or publish voucher API method. 

<!-- title: My Table Title -->

| Required | Optional |
| -------- | :------: |
| `type`:`LOYALTY_CARD` |  `type`:`DISCOUNT_VOUCHER`   | 
| `is_referral_code`:`true`      |    `type`:`GIFT_VOUCHER`   |

object.description: The type of object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the `url` attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of publications can be accessed using a GET method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/publications`

loyalty_tiers_expiration.description: Defines the expiration mechanism for loyal tiers.

qualification_type.description:
Tier qualification.   

`BALANCE`: Points balance is based on the customer's current points balance. Customers qualify for the tier if their points balance is in the points range of the tier.

start_date.description: Defines the conditions for the start date of the tier.

type.description:
What triggers the tier to be valid for a customer.    
`IMMEDIATE`: After reaching minimum required points

expiration_date.description: Defines the conditions for the expiration date of a tier.

type.description: What triggers the tier to expire for a customer.

extend.description: Defines the amount of time the tier will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a tier with a duration of P3M will be valid for a duration of 3 months.

rounding.description: Defines the rounding mechanism for tier expiration.

type.description: Period to which the expiration will be rounded to.

strategy.description: Which portion of the period should the rounding be applied to.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. Default is `voucher`.

1_req_vouchers__POST.title: Create Voucher Request Body
1_req_vouchers__POST.description: Request body schema for creating a voucher.

examples.additional_info: This voucher will remain inactive until enabled.

code.description: A code that identifies a voucher. Pattern can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters. Pass this attribute in the request body if you want to deliberately create a distinct code. Otherwise, use the `code_config` object to design rules that the Voucherify API should use to create a random code.

campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the voucher's parent campaign. **Required** for `LOYALTY_CARD` type.

campaign_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

type.description: Defines the type of voucher.

discount.description:
Defines discount voucher; **required** when`type` is `DISCOUNT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`. Type of discount:
- `AMOUNT`
- `PERCENT`
- `UNIT`
- `FIXED`

A Free Shipping discount is a special instance of the  `UNIT` type discount.

gift.description: Defines gift card; **required** when type parameter is `GIFT_VOUCHER`.

amount.description: Total gift card income. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order

loyalty_card.description: Defines loyalty card; **required** when type parameter is `LOYALTY_CARD`.

points.description: Define how many points the loyalty card should have initially.

start_date.description: Start date defines when the code starts to be active. Activation timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the code expires. Expiration timestamp in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the voucher is active. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the voucher will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a voucher with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a voucher with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the voucher is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

validation_rules.description: Array containing the id of the validation rule associated with the voucher.

redemption.description: Stores the quantity of redemptions that can be applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

code_config.description: Defines code's pattern (prefix, suffix, length, charset, etc). Pass this attribute in the request body if you want to design rules that the Voucherify API should use to create a random code. Otherwise, use the `code` object to define a distinct code.

length.description: Number of characters in a generated code (excluding prefix and postfix).

charset.description:
Characters that can appear in the code.  

Examples:

- Alphanumeric: `0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Alphabetic: `abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Alphabetic Lowercase: `abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz` 
- Alphabetic Uppercase: `ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Numbers: `0123456789`  
- Custom: a custom character set

prefix.description: A text appended before the code.

postfix.description: A text appended after the code.

pattern.description: A pattern for codes where hashes (#) will be replaced with random characters. Overrides `length`.

1_req_vouchers_code_POST.description: Request body schema for creating a voucher.

A Free Shipping discount is a special instance of the  `UNIT` type discount.

1_req_vouchers_code_PUT.title: Update Voucher Request Body
1_req_vouchers_code_PUT.description: Request body schema for updating a voucher.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

discount.description:
Defines discount voucher; **required** when`type` is `DISCOUNT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`. Type of discount:
- `AMOUNT`
- `PERCENT`
- `UNIT`
- `FIXED`

A Free Shipping discount is a special instance of the  `UNIT` type discount.

gift.description: Defines gift card; **required** when type parameter is `GIFT_VOUCHER`.

amount.description: Total voucher income. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order

loyalty_card.description: Defines loyalty card; **required** when type parameter is `LOYALTY_CARD`.

points.description:
Update the total points incurred over lifespan of loyalty card. If you set a value higher than the stored value for this parameter, then the `balance` parameter of the loyalty card will increase by the difference. If you set a value lower than the stored value for this parameter, then the `balance` parameter of the loyalty cards will decrease by the difference.    
Expect this result:    

Δ `balance` parameter: points<sub>in request body</sub> - points<sub>stored in Voucherify system</sub>

start_date.description: Start date defines when the code starts to be active. Activation timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the code expires. Expiration timestamp in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the voucher is active. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the voucher will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a voucher with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a voucher with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the voucher is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

1_req_vouchers_metadata_async.title: Update Vouchers' Metadata in Bulk Request Body

codes.description: A string array of voucher codes.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

type.description: Applies an amount discount.

amount_off.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000. In case of the amount being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `amount_off_formula` parameter is present in the amount definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the amount off.

amount_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculated the discount.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order

type.description: Applies a percentage discount.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

percent_off.description: Percent taken off the subtotal amount. In case of the percent being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `percent_off_formula` parameter is present in the percent definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the percent off.

percent_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculated the discount.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

type.description: Sets a fixed total on cart or item(s) and then calculates the discount to apply.

fixed_amount.description:
Set a fixed valued for an order total or price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000. In case of the fixed amount being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `fixed_amount_formula` parameter is present in the fixed amount definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed value.    
| **Effect** | **Definition** |
|---|---|
| **APPLY_TO_ORDER** | Sets the order total amount to the value of the fixed amount. The discount value is calculated during the redemption as it's a difference between the total amount of the customer's order and the fixed amount. |
| **APPLY_TO_ITEMS** | Sets a new price on items. The total discount amount is calculated during the redemption and it's a difference between the initial item price and the fixed amount. |

fixed_amount_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the discounted price of an item or a new order total.

effect.description:
- **APPLY\_TO\_ORDER**: Set fixed total on the whole cart. Discount will be calculated dynamically, based on fixed amount value. For example, if the fixed amount is set to equal $10 and order amount equals $25, then the calculated discount will be $15.  
- **APPLY\_TO\_ITEMS**: This type of deal applies a new price for line items. 
  Default rules:
   - During redemption, prices will change only if the new one is lower than the old one.
    - If a product price in the collection and the new product price you have set up differs, then the new product price will be passed during the redemption.
    - When a product is in two collections, we always change the price to the lowest price.
    - The new price for products with several SKUs will force the price change for SKUs if their price is higher than the new price.

type.description: Applies a full value discount to item(s).

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount. In case of the unit being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `unit_off_formula` parameter is present in the unit definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the unit value.

unit_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculated the number of units.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product  inventory (e.g. time, items).

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

type.description: Applies a full value discount to item(s).

effect.description: Defines the effect for adding multiple item types.

units.description: Array of objects defining items to be offered for free. Each item type can have a different discount effect assigned.

items.description: Object defining a unit discount.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount. In case of the unit being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `unit_off_formula` parameter is present in the unit definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the unit value.

unit_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculated the number of units.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product  inventory (e.g. time, items).

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

type.description: Applies a full value discount to item(s).

unit_off.description: Subtracts 1 shipping item from the subtotal.

unit_type.description: The shipping product deemed as free.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

type.description: Applies an amount discount.

amount_off.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000. In case of the amount being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `amount_off_formula` parameter is present in the amount definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the amount off.

amount_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculated the discount.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

type.description: Applies a percentage discount.

percent_off.description: Percent taken off the subtotal amount. In case of the percent being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `percent_off_formula` parameter is present in the percent definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the percent off.

percent_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculated the discount.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

type.description: Sets a fixed total on cart or item(s) and then calculates the discount to apply.

fixed_amount.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000. In case of the fixed amount being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `fixed_amount_formula` parameter is present in the fixed amount definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed value.

fixed_amount_formula.description: Formula used to calculated the discount.

effect.description:
- **APPLY\_TO\_ORDER**: Set fixed total on the whole cart. Discount will be calculated dynamically, based on fixed amount value. For example, if the fixed amount is set to equal $10 and order amount equals $25, then the calculated discount will be $15.  
- **APPLY\_TO\_ITEMS**: This type of deal applies a new price for line items. 
  Default rules:
   - During redemption, prices will change only if the new one is lower than the old one.
    - If a product price in the collection and the new product price you have set up differs, then the new product price will be passed during the redemption.
    - When a product is in two collections, we always change the price to the lowest price.
    - The new price for products with several SKUs will force the price change for SKUs if their price is higher than the new price.

type.description: Applies a full value discount to item(s).

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount. In case of the unit being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `unit_off_formula` parameter is present in the unit definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the unit value.

1_req_vouchers_code_balance.title: Add Gift Voucher Balance Request Body

amount.description: The incremental amount to be added to the current balance on the gift card. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

1_res_vouchers_code_balance.title: Add Gift Voucher Balance Response Body

amount.description: The incremental amount added to the current balance on the gift card. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

total.description: Total income incurred over the lifespan of the gift card.

balance.description: The balance after adding an additional amount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

type.description: The type of voucher being modified.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON.

related_object.description: Defines the resource that is being modified with the values that are returned in the balance object.

type.description: The object being modified.

id.description: Identifies the voucher that is being modified, this is the ID that was assigned by the Voucherify API.

1_obj_vouchers_import_gift_voucher.title: Import Gift Voucher
1_obj_vouchers_import_gift_voucher.description: Object model for gift voucher object being imported.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

type.description: Represents the voucher type.

amount.description: Total gift card income. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date. Start date defines when the code starts to be active.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the code expires. Expiration timestamp in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

redemption.description: Stores the quantity of redemptions that can be applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

1_obj_vouchers_import_discount_voucher.title: Import Discount Voucher
1_obj_vouchers_import_discount_voucher.description: Object model for discount voucher object being imported.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

type.description: Represents the voucher type.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date. Start date defines when the code starts to be active.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the code expires. Expiration timestamp in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

redemption.description: Stores the quantity of redemptions that can be applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

1_req_vouchers_importCSV.title: Import Vouchers by CSV Request Body

file.description: The property name 'file' will be used for the file path.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. Default is `list`.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of qualified vouchers.

total.description: Total valid and active vouchers matching the qualification criteria in given context.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the qualification was created in ISO 8601 format.

1_req_vouchers_bulk_async.title: Vouchers Bulk Async Request Body
1_req_vouchers_bulk_async.description: Array of objects each containing the code to be updated and the metadata object containing the key/value pairs to be updated.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

order.description: Tracks purchase transactions. You can send the order in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific order validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure/Order volume_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Order_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

id.description: The ID of an existing order in Voucherify's system that will be linked to the redemption of this request. This ID was assigned by the Voucherify API. You can send the order id in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific order validation rules to be satisfied.

source_id.description: The merchant’s order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

amount.description:
Pre-discount order amount represents the total amount of order items' amounts (sum of each item's `amount` property). You can send the total order amount or the amount of each item individually in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific total order amount validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order volume_ → _Total amount_ 

Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

items.description: List of Order Items constituting the order. Order items can be defined either by `product_id` or `sku_id`. For every item, you must define the quantity. Read more about the [order item object] (hyperlink the Order Item Object).

referrer.description: The person who referred the customer to make the order.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **order** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Order metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _ORDER METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **redemption** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Advanced_ → _Redemption metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _REDEMPTION METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_custome.title: Customer Object
1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_custome.description: This object stores customer details. You can send this object in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific customer validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Audience_ → _Customer segment_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Customer Activity_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

id.description: The ID of an existing customer that will be linked to the redemption in this request. This ID was assigned by the Voucherify API.

source_id.description: A unique customer identifier. This is a tracking identifier of a user that is validating a voucher. The `source_id` is built based on your internal id (e.g., email, database ID). If you also pass a customer ID, the source ID will be ignored. Otherwise, if you do not pass a customer ID, the source ID you provide must either be a token, like the one returned in the original voucher validation method done by a specific customer, or a string identifying the customer (e.g., email, database ID, CRM ID).

name.description: First and Last Name. You can send the name in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific name validation rules to be satisfied.

email.description: You can send the email in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific email validation rules to be satisfied.

phone.description: You can send the phone in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific phone validation rules to be satisfied.

address.description: A set of key/value pairs which describes the address. You can send the address in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific address validation rules to be satisfied.

city.description: You can send the city in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific city validation rules to be satisfied.

country.description: You can send the country in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific country validation rules to be satisfied.

postal_code.description: You can send the postal code in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific postal code validation rules to be satisfied.

state.description: You can send the state in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific state validation rules to be satisfied.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **customer** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Audience_ → _Customer metadata satisfy_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

birthdate.description: You can send the birthdate in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific birthdate validation rules to be satisfied.

1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_product.title: Product Item
1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_product.description: Schema model for a product item. You can send this object in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific product validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure/Order volume_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Order_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

source_id.description:
A unique product identifier from your inventory system. __Requires__ the `related_object` property to be defined. 

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the Create Validation Rules endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on Source Id filters_ . [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

product_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

amount.description:
Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`). You can send the total item amount to check against vouchers requiring specific order amount validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order volume_ → _Total amount_. The qualification adds the individual amounts of the items and checks whether the sum meets the limits set by the _Total amount_. Additionally, another rule checked is one that is defined in _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Subtotal of matched items_.  

Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

quantity.description:
Quantity of the item in the cart. 

The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Volume_ → _Items quantity_. The qualification adds the individual quantities of the items and checks whether the sum meets the limits set by _Items quantity_ validation rule. Another validation rule against which the qualification does the checks is defined in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Quantity of matched items_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

price.description:
Unit price of an item. [This is not true in the case of using sourceid what was the case that this happened.]This `price` property takes precedence. If you provide a value at this level, then a price property defined once again in the `related_object` will be ignored. If this property will not be defined here, then the `price` property in the `related_object` will be used in the qualification.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the Create Validation Rules endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Unit Price of any matching order line_ and also _Order Volume_ → _Price of each item/Price of any item_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

 Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

metadata.description:
A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **order line item** metadata validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Metadata of matched items_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

related_object.description: A reference to the object containing details of the related product. __Required__ when sending `source_id` in payload.

product.description: An object containing details of the related product. __Required__ when sending `source_id` in payload. These details will be used for qualification on top of details already stored in the system.

source_id.description: A unique product identifier from your inventory system.

name.description:
Product name.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on name filters_.

price.description: Unit price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

metadata.description:
A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **product** metadata validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on metadata filters_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_product.title: Product Item using product_id
1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_product.description:
Schema model for a product item sent using the `product_id`. 

You can send this object in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific product validation rules to be satisfied. 
The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure/Order volume_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Order_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

product_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

amount.description:
Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`). You can send the total item amount to check against vouchers requiring specific order amount validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order volume_ → _Total amount_. The qualification adds the individual amounts of the items and checks whether the sum meets the limits set by the _Total amount_. Additionally, another rule checked is one that is defined in _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Subtotal of matched items_.  

Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

quantity.description:
Quantity of the item in the cart. 

The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Volume_ → _Items quantity_. The qualification adds the individual quantities of the items and checks whether the sum meets the limits set by _Items quantity_ validation rule. Another validation rule against which the qualification does the checks is defined in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Quantity of matched items_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

price.description:
Unit price of an item. [This is not true in the case of using sourceid what was the case that this happened.]This `price` property takes precedence. If you provide a value at this level, then a price property defined once again in the `related_object` will be ignored. If this property will not be defined here, then the `price` property in the `related_object` will be used in the qualification.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the Create Validation Rules endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Unit Price of any matching order line_ and also _Order Volume_ → _Price of each item/Price of any item_. Even if this price is explicitly provided, it will not override the `price` when running qualifications against _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select/create a product collection filtered by a Price_.   [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

 Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

metadata.description:
A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **order line item** metadata validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Metadata of matched items_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

product.description: An object containing details of the related product. These details will be used for qualification on top of details already stored in the system.

name.description:
Product name.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on name filters_.

price.description: Unit price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

metadata.description:
A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **product** metadata validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on metadata filters_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_sku-cop.title: SKU Item
1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_sku-cop.description: Schema model for a SKU item.

source_id.description: The merchant’s product/SKU ID (if it is different from the Voucherify product/SKU ID). It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce, a database or a 3rd-party service.

amount.description:
Represents a total amount of order item (price * quantity).

You should provide it to retrieve `discount_amount` if the discount is applied only to this item.[I'm not sure what this means here, it's from the original docs]

quantity.description: Quantity of the item in the cart.

price.description: Unit price of an item

sku.description: An object containing details of the related SKU. These details will be used for validation and redemption processes on top of details already stored in the system.

override.description: The override is used once the product should be stored in system. If sku does not exist it will be created with the use of `source_id`. If sku does not exists it's required to set `product_id` that it belongs to.

customer.description: This object stores customer details. You can send this object in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific customer validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Audience_ → _Customer segment_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Customer Activity_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

id.description: The ID of an existing customer that will be linked to the redemption in this request. This ID was assigned by the Voucherify API.

source_id.description: A unique customer identifier. This is a tracking identifier of a user that is validating a voucher. The `source_id` is built based on your internal id (e.g., email, database ID). If you also pass a customer ID, the source ID will be ignored. Otherwise, if you do not pass a customer ID, the source ID you provide must either be a token, like the one returned in the original voucher validation method done by a specific customer, or a string identifying the customer (e.g., email, database ID, CRM ID).

name.description: First and Last Name. You can send the name in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific name validation rules to be satisfied.

email.description: You can send the email in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific email validation rules to be satisfied.

phone.description: You can send the phone in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific phone validation rules to be satisfied.

address.description: A set of key/value pairs which describes the address. You can send the address in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific address validation rules to be satisfied.

city.description: You can send the city in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific city validation rules to be satisfied.

country.description: You can send the country in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific country validation rules to be satisfied.

postal_code.description: You can send the postal code in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific postal code validation rules to be satisfied.

state.description: You can send the state in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific state validation rules to be satisfied.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **customer** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Audience_ → _Customer metadata satisfy_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

birthdate.description: You can send the birthdate in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific birthdate validation rules to be satisfied.

order.description: Tracks purchase transactions. You can send the order in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific order validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure/Order volume_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Order_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

id.description: The ID of an existing order in Voucherify's system that will be linked to the redemption of this request. This ID was assigned by the Voucherify API. You can send the order id in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific order validation rules to be satisfied.

source_id.description: The merchant’s order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

amount.description:
Pre-discount order amount represents the total amount of order items' amounts (sum of each item's `amount` property). You can send the amount in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific order amount validation rules to be satisfied. 

Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

items.description: List of Order Items constituting the order. Order items can be defined either by `product_id` or `sku_id`. For every item, you must define the quantity. Read more about the [order item object] (hyperlink the Order Item Object).

referrer.description: The person who referred the customer to make the order.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **order** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Order metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _ORDER METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **redemption** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Advanced_ → _Redemption metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _REDEMPTION METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_product.title: Product Item
1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_product.description: Schema model for a product item.

source_id.description: Product/SKU reference ID

amount.description:
Represents a total amount of order item (price * quantity).

You should provide it to retrieve `discount_amount` if the discount is applied only to this item.

quantity.description: Quantity of the item in the cart.

price.description: Unit price of an item

product.description: An object containing details of the related product. These details will be used for validation and redemption processes on top of details already stored in the system.

sku.description: An object containing details of the related SKU. These details will be used for validation and redemption processes on top of details already stored in the system.

override.description: The override is used once the product should be stored in system. If sku does not exists it will be created with the use of `source_id`. If sku does not exists it's required to set `product_id` that it belongs to.

customer.description: This object stores customer details.

id.description: The ID of an existing customer that will be linked to the redemption in this request. Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the customer.

source_id.description: A unique customer identifier. You can provide your own (e.g. CRM id) or use the one returned by Voucherify, see tracking_id from Validate Voucher (client-side). A tracking identifier of a user that validate a voucher. It is build based on your internal id (e.g., email, database ID). If you also pass a customer ID, the source ID will be ignored. Otherwise, if you do not pass a customer ID, the source ID you provide must either be a token, like the ones returned in origin voucher validation method done by specific customer, or a string identifying customer (e.g., email, database ID, CRM ID).

address.description: A set of key/value pairs which describes the address.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer object for segment building. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format.

order.description: Tracks purchase transactions.

id.description: The ID of an existing order that will be linked to redemption in this request.

source_id.description: The merchant’s order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from CRM, database or 3rd party service.

amount.description:
Represents a total amount of order items (sum of item.amount)

Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

discount_amount.description:
Summarize all discounts applied to the order inlcuding discounts applied to particular order line items and discounts applied to the whole cart.

Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

items.description: List of Order Items constituting the order. Order items can be defined either by product_id or sku_id. Along with every item you must define quantity.A list of Order Items that have been applied to the order. hyperlink the Order Items to another object.

key.description: Unique session identifier assigned by the Voucherify API.

type.description:
The type of session. Required to establish a new session. 

`LOCK`: Locks the following parameters within the session:

- redemption quantity by 1
- redemption gift credits specified with the requests
- redemption loyalty points specified with the request

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by `session.ttl_unit`.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

tracking_id.description: A tracking identifier of a user that validated a voucher. Identifier generated during voucher validation.

res_empty_json.description: Schema model for an empty json.
res_empty_json.title: Empty JSON

2_obj_campaign_object.title: Campaign Object
2_obj_campaign_object.description: This is an object representing a campaign.

id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

description.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the campaign such as a campaign description and details.

type.description:
Defines whether the campaign can be updated with new vouchers after campaign creation.    

- `AUTO_UPDATE`: the campaign is dynamic, i.e. vouchers will generate based on set criteria    
-  `STATIC`: vouchers need to be manually published

auto_join.description: Indicates whether customers will be able to auto-join a loyalty campaign if any earning rule is fulfilled.

join_once.description: If this value is set to `true`, customers will be able to join the campaign only once.

use_voucher_metadata_schema.description: Flag indicating whether the campaign is to use the voucher's metadata schema instead of the campaign metadata schema.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the campaign is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a campaign with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P1D` will be valid for a duration of one day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the campaign is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

activity_duration_after_publishing.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in ISO 8601 format after publishing. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P24D` will be valid for a duration of 24 days.

vouchers_count.description: Total number of unique vouchers in campaign.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the campaign on or off. You can disable a campaign even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the campaign. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a campaign object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the campaign in a structured format.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was updated in ISO 8601 format.

creation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign creation.

vouchers_generation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign's vouchers.

protected.description: Indicates whether the resource can be deleted.

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the campaign.

referral_program.description: Defines the referee reward and the way a referral is triggered. Context: `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

custom_event.description: Contains details about the custom event.

id.description: Unique custom event ID.

related_object_parent.description: Details of the resource from which the reward originates.

id.description: Unique ID of the reward source.

object.description: Type of resource represented by the source of the reward.

type.description: Type of reward.

amount.description: The number of `points` to add to a loyalty card or `credits` to the balance on a gift card. In case of the gift card, the value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

2_req_create_campaign.title: Create  Campaign Request Body
2_req_create_campaign.description: Request body schema for creating a campaign using **POST** `/campaigns`.

description.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the campaign such as a campaign description and details.

type.description:
Defines whether the campaign can be updated with new vouchers after campaign creation.    

- `AUTO_UPDATE`: By choosing the auto update option you will create a campaign that can be enhanced by new vouchers after the time of creation (e.g. by publish vouchers method).    
-  `STATIC`: vouchers need to be manually published.

auto_join.description: Indicates whether customers will be able to auto-join a loyalty campaign if any earning rule is fulfilled. CONTEXT: `LOYALTY_PROGRAM`.

join_once.description: If this value is set to `true`, customers will be able to join the campaign only once.

use_voucher_metadata_schema.description: Flag indicating whether the campaign is to use the voucher's metadata schema instead of the campaign metadata schema.

vouchers_count.description: Total number of unique vouchers in campaign (size of campaign).

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the campaign is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P1D` will be valid for a duration of one day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the campaign is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

2_req_add_vouchers_to_campaign.title: Add Vouchers to Campaign Request Body

category_id.description: Unique category ID that you would like to assign to the voucher.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the voucher starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the voucher expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the voucher. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

redemption.description: Stores the quantity of redemptions that can be applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

code_config.description: Defines code's pattern (prefix, suffix, length, charset, etc).

length.description: Number of characters in a generated code (excluding prefix and postfix).

charset.description:
Characters that can appear in the code.  

Examples:

- Alphanumeric: `0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Alphabetic: `abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Alphabetic Lowercase: `abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz` 
- Alphabetic Uppercase: `ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Numbers: `0123456789`  
- Custom: a custom character set

prefix.description: A text appended before the code.

postfix.description: A text appended after the code.

pattern.description: A pattern for codes where hashes (#) will be replaced with random characters. Overrides `length`.

gift.description: Assign an initial cash balance for a gift card. Context: `GIFT_VOUCHERS`.

amount.description: The cash balance to assign to the gift card. This is the current gift card balance.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about campaigns in a dictionary.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of campaign objects.
