3_obj_promotion_tier_object.description: This is an object representing a promotion tier. Promotion tiers are always assigned to a campaign and cannot be used standalone.
3_obj_promotion_tier_object.title: Promotion Tier Object

id.description: Unique promotion tier ID.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the promotion tier was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the promotion tier was updated in ISO 8601 format.

banner.description: Text to be displayed to your customers on your website.

action.description: Contains details about the discount applied by the promotion tier.

discount.description: The type of discount that will be applied to a customer's order.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the promotion tier. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a promotion tier object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the promotion tier in a structured format.

hierarchy.description: The promotions hierarchy defines the order in which the discounts from different tiers will be applied to a customer's order. If a customer qualifies for discounts from more than one tier, discounts will be applied in the order defined in the hierarchy.

promotion_id.description: Promotion tier's parent campaign's unique ID.

campaign.description: Contains details about promotion tier's parent campaign.

id.description: Unique campaign ID.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Recurrent time periods when the campaign is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a campaign with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P1D` will be valid for a duration of one day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the campaign is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

active.description:
A flag indicating whether the campaign is active or not active. A campaign can be disabled even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date` using the [Disable Campaign endpoint](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1campaigns~1{campaignId}~1disable).  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

object.description: The type of object represented by the campaign object. This object stores information about the campaign.

campaign_id.description: Promotion tier's parent campaign's unique ID.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the promotion tier on or off. You can disable a promotion tier even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* promotion tier
- `false` indicates an *inactive* promotion tier

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the promotion tier is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a promotion tier with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the promotion tier will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a promotion tier with a `duration` of `P1D` will be valid for a duration of one day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the promotion tier is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

summary.description: Contains statistics about promotion tier redemptions and orders.

redemptions.description: Contains statistics about promotion tier redemptions.

total_redeemed.description: Number of times the promotion tier was redeemed.

orders.description: Contains statistics about orders related to the promotion tier.

total_discount_amount.description: Sum of total discount applied using the promotion tier.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the promotion tier.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the promotion tier is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the promotion tier will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a promotion tier with a `duration` of `P1D` will be valid for a duration of one day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the promotion tier is valid.

- `0`  Sunday

hierarchy.description: The promotions hierarchy defines the order in which the discounts from different tiers will be applied to a customer's order. If a customer qualifies for discounts from more than one tier, discounts will be applied in the order defined in the hierarchy. If you update a hierarchy of a promotion tier, then the remaining promotion tier hierarchies will be recalculated.

4_obj_reward_object.description: This is an object representing a reward.

type.description: Reward type.

stock.description: Configurable for **material rewards**. The number of units of the product that you want to share as reward.

id.description: Unique publication ID, assigned by Voucherify.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the customer receiving the publication.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the publication. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a publication object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the publication in a structured format.

channel.description: How the publication was originated. It can be your own custom channel or an example value provided here.

source_id.description: The merchant’s publication ID if it is different from the Voucherify publication ID. It's an optional tracking identifier of a publication. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a publication ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

customer.description: Contains information about the customer to whom the publication was directed.

It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. This metadata can be used for validating whether the customer qualifies for a discount or it can be used in building customer segments.

balance.description: The credit balance on the gift card after the initial incremental amount is added to the gift card. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

is_referral_code.description: Whether this voucher is a referral code.

customer.description: Customer's information.

order.description: Order information.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **redemption** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The validation runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Advanced_ → _Redemption metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _REDEMPTION METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

6_req_validate_voucher_gift_card.title: Gift Card
6_req_validate_voucher_gift_card.description: Request schema model for validating a gift card voucher using **POST** `/vouchers/{code}/validate`.

gift.description: Contains information on the number of gift card credits that the customer wants to apply to the order.

credits.description: The number of credits that the user wants to use from the gift card to fulfil the order. The value of credits cannot be higher than the current balance on the gift card. If the user gives more points than he has on the gift card, the application will return an error code in response. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

customer.description: Customer's information.

order.description: Order information.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **redemption** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The validation runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Advanced_ → _Redemption metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _REDEMPTION METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

reward.description: Contains information about the reward that the customer wants to redeem and the number of points the customer is choosing to use for the reward.

id.description: Unique reward ID assigned by Voucherify. The reward must be assigned to the campaign in order for the user to be able to use the reward.

points.description: The number of loyalty points that the user wants to spend in order to fulfill the order. The number of points cannot be higher than the current balance on the loyalty card. If the user gives more points than he/she has on the loyalty card, the application will return an error code in response.

customer.description: Customer's information.

order.description: Order information.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **redemption** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The validation runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Advanced_ → _Redemption metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _REDEMPTION METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

6_req_session_lock_discount_code.title: Discount Code Session Lock
6_req_session_lock_discount_code.description: Schema model for `session` lock object. The session object is **required** to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests. If you only send the `type` parameter in the request, then by default the session lock will be established for 7 days. Read more on establishing a [validation session](docs/validations/Validation-Session.md).

type.description: This parameter is **required** to establish a new session. The session locks the redemption **quantity** by 1.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID. Sending an existing ID will result in overwriting an existing session. If no session key is provided, then a new ID will be generated.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by the `session.ttl_unit` parameter.

If you only send the `type` parameter in the request, then by default the session lock will be established for 7 days. Read more on establishing a [validation session](docs/validations/Validation-Session.md).

type.description: This parameter is **required** to establish a new session. The session locks the redemption **quantity** by 1 and the redemption **gift credits** specified within the request.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID. Sending an existing ID will result in overwriting an existing session. If no session key is provided, then a new ID will be generated.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by the `session.ttl_unit` parameter.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_amount.title: Amount Discount
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_amount.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

type.description: Defines the type of voucher.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

amount_off.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_percent.title: Percent Discount
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_percent.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

type.description: Defines the type of voucher.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

percent_off.description: The percent discount that the customer will receive.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_fixed.title: Fixed Discount
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_fixed.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value. A fixed discounts sets a fixed total on cart or item(s) and then calculates the discount to apply.

type.description: Type of discount.

effect.description:
Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.    
    
| **Effect** | **Definition** |
|---|---|
| **APPLY_TO_ORDER** | Sets the order total amount to the value of the fixed amount. The discount value is calculated during the redemption as it's a difference between the total amount of the customer's order and the fixed amount. |
| **APPLY_TO_ITEMS** | Sets a new price on items. The total discount amount is calculated during the redemption and it's a difference between the initial item price and the fixed amount. |

fixed_amount.description: Set a fixed valued for an order total or price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000. In case of the fixed amount being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `fixed_amount_formula` parameter is present in the fixed amount definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed value.

6_req_validate_promotion.title: Validate Promotion Request Body
6_req_validate_promotion.description: Request schema model for validating a promotion using **POST** `/promotions/validation`.

customer.description: Customer's information.

order.description: Order information.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **redemption** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The validation runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Advanced_ → _Redemption metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _REDEMPTION METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

options.description: Configure parameters returned in the response.

expand.description: Expand array lets you configure params included in the response. Depending on the strings included in the array, the response will contain different details. Add `category` as a string in the array to include a `categories` object in the response.

valid.description: Indicates whether the promotion is valid within the context of the parameters provided in the request body and filters in the query parameters.

promotions.description: Contains an array of promotion tier objects.

valid.description: Indicates whether the promotion is valid within the context of the parameters provided in the request body and filters in the query parameters.

id.description: Unique promotion tier ID.

banner.description: Text to be displayed to your customers on your website.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive* after this date.

active.description:
A flag indicating whether the campaign is active or not active. A campaign can be disabled even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

19_req_validations.title: Validate Stackable Discounts (Beta) Request Body
19_req_validations.description: This data model represents the request body for the `/validations` endpoint.

options.description: Configure parameters returned in the response.

expand.description:
Expand array lets you configure params included in the response. Depending on the strings included in the array, the response will contain different details. | **Expand Option** | **Response Body** | |:---|:---| | ["order"] | - Same response as fallback response (without an options object).
- Order data with calculated discounts are listed in each child redeemable object.
- Metadata not included for each discount type. | | ["redeemable"] | Expands redeemable objects by including `metadata` for each discount type. | | ["order", "redeemable"] | - Order data with calculated discounts are listed in each child redeemable object.
- Includes `metadata` for each discount type. |

redeemables.description: An array of redeemables. You can combine `voucher`(s) and `promotion_tier`(s). Alternatively, send one unique`promotion_stack` in the array.

object.description: Redeemable object type.

id.description:
Redeemable code or unique ID such as:  
- discount code, loyalty card, gift card, referral code: `DiscountCode100`, `v_6ZPI2BLMtpc6zz8pQVjQgxJH3D4ac3ZT`  
- promotion tier: `promo_Mwy9XpA0TLctSGriM5kum0qp` 
- promotion stack: `stack_KxSD0GahLUg9ULB6TseGfUHJ`

session.description: The session object required to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests. Read more on [establishing a validation session](../docs/stackableDiscounts/Establish-Validation-Session.md).

order.description: Order object enables you to pass purchase transaction data. Read what properties you can use in the [Order object reference](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/10_obj_order_object).

customer.description: Stores data of the customer related to the redemption. Read more about the [Customer object](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/9_obj_customer_object).

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a redemption object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the redemption in a structured format.

error.message: Inactive Promotion

error.message: Promotion expired.

error.message: Promotion expired.

valid.description: The result of the validation. It takes all of the redeemables into account and returns a `false` if at least one redeemable is inapplicable. Returns `true` if all redeemables are applicable.

redeemables.description: Lists validation results of each redeemable. If a redeemable can be applied, the API returns `"status": "APPLICABLE"`.

status.description: Indicates whether the redeemable can be applied or not applied based on the validation rules. `SKIPPED` indicates that the validation stopped once it identified at least one unapplicable redeemable and did not continue to validate the given redeemable.

19_obj_order_object_validation_res.title: Order object
19_obj_order_object_validation_res.description: Contains the combined effect of all redeemables taken into account on the order object properties.

amount.description: Order amount before applying any discount.

discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order.  
`sum(redeemables.order.applied_discount_amount)`

items_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied to the order.  
`sum(items, i => i.discount_amount)`

total_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied to the order.  
`total_discount_amount` = `discount_amount` + `items_discount_amount`

total_amount.description:
Order amount after applying all the discounts.  
`total_amount` = `amount` - `total_discount_amount`

applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level discounts applied in a particular request.  
`sum(redeemables.order.applied_discount_amount)`

items_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request.  
`sum(items, i => i.applied_discount_amount)`

total_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request.  
`total_applied_discount_amount` = `applied_discount_amount` + `items_applied_discount_amount`

items.description: Array of order items showing the effects of particular discounts on the item-level.

subtotal_amount.description:
Final order item amount after the applied item-level discount.  If there are no item-level discounts applied, this item is equal to the `amount`.   
`subtotal_amount`=`amount`-`applied_discount_amount`

19_obj_order_object_validation_res_per_r.title: Order object
19_obj_order_object_validation_res_per_r.description: Contains the effect of each redeemable on the order and specific cart items. The amounts are consecutively built on the previous redeemable's effects, such that for each redeemable, the amounts are further reduced by the redeemable. The sequence in the request body is important because that will be the sequence the redeemables are applied one on top of the other.

discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order.  
`sum(redeemables.order.applied_discount_amount)`

items_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied to the order.  
`sum(items, i => i.discount_amount)`

total_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied to the order.  
`total_discount_amount` = `discount_amount` + `items_discount_amount`

total_amount.description:
Order amount after applying all the discounts.  
`total_amount` = `amount` - `total_discount_amount`

applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level discounts applied in a particular request.  
`sum(redeemables.order.applied_discount_amount)`

items_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request.  
`sum(items, i => i.applied_discount_amount)`

total_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request.  
`total_applied_discount_amount` = `applied_discount_amount` + `items_applied_discount_amount`

items.description: Array of order items showing the effects of particular discounts on the item-level.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the order item.

product_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

sku_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

quantity.description: Quantity of the item in the cart.

amount.description: Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`).

price.description: Unit price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

subtotal_amount.description:
Final order item amount after the applied item-level discount.  If there are no item-level discounts applied, this item is equal to the `amount`.   
`subtotal_amount`=`amount`-`applied_discount_amount`

product.description: This object stores more information about the related product.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique product identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price of a product. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

sku.description: This object stores more information about the related SKU.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique SKU identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price of a SKU. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the order. A set of key/value pairs that are att to an order object. Stores additional information about the order in a structured format.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the order.

order.description: Contains the order details associated with the redemption.

id.description: Unique order ID.

source_id.description: Unique order source ID.

7_obj_redemption_object.title: Redemption Object
7_obj_redemption_object.description:
This is an object representing a redemption.  

Redemption is the key operation in the voucher and promotion tier lifecycle. A customer can redeem a voucher or promotion tier once or multiple times depending on selected limit (`quantity`). Each redemption is recorded in voucher/promotion's history (`redemption_entries`). There is also an option to cancel a redemption. We call such operation a [redemption rollback](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1redemptions~1{redemption_id}~1rollback/post).

7_obj_redemption_object_discount_voucher.title: Redemption Object for Discount Voucher
7_obj_redemption_object_discount_voucher.description:
This is an object representing a redemption.

Each redemption is recorded in voucher/promotion's history (`redemption_entries`). There is also an option to cancel a redemption. We call such operation a [redemption rollback](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1redemptions~1{redemption_id}~1rollback/post).

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

object.description: The type of object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the customer.

date.description: Timestamp indicating when the redemption occured.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the redeeming customer.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes in the form of key/value pairs assigned to the redemption.

failure_code.description: If the result is `FAILURE`, this parameter will provide a generic reason as to why the redemption failed.

failure_message.description: If the result is `FAILURE`, this parameter will provide a more expanded reason as to why the redemption failed.

8_obj_loyalty_campaign_object.title: Loyalty Campaign Object
8_obj_loyalty_campaign_object.description:
This is an object representing a loyalty campaign.  

The loyalty campaign object contains details about the loyalty campaign. You can use dedicated endpoints to list loyalty campaigns, list loyalty card holders, member activities, active rewards, earning rules, loyalty tiers for given loyalty campaign.

id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

type.description:
Defines whether the campaign can be updated with new vouchers after campaign creation.    

- `AUTO_UPDATE`: the campaign is dynamic, i.e. vouchers will generate based on set criteria    
-  `STATIC`: vouchers need to be manually published

auto_join.description: Indicates whether customers will be able to auto-join a loyalty campaign if any earning rule is fulfilled.

join_once.description: If this value is set to `true`, customers will be able to join the campaign only once.

use_voucher_metadata_schema.description: Flag indicating whether the campaign is to use the voucher's metadata schema instead of the campaign metadata schema.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the campaign is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a campaign with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P1D` will be valid for a duration of one day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the campaign is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

activity_duration_after_publishing.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in ISO 8601 format after publishing. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P24D` will be valid for a duration of 24 days.

description.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the campaign such as a campaign description and details.

vouchers_count.description: Total number of unique vouchers in campaign.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the campaign on or off. You can disable a campaign even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the campaign. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a campaign object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the campaign in a structured format.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was updated in ISO 8601 format.

creation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign creation.

vouchers_generation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign's vouchers.

protected.description: Indicates whether the resource can be deleted.

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

loyalty_tiers_expiration.description: Defines the expiration mechanism for loyal tiers.

qualification_type.description:
Tier qualification.   

`BALANCE`: Points balance is based on the customer's current points balance. Customers qualify for the tier if their points balance is in the points range of the tier.

start_date.description: Defines the conditions for the start date of the tier.

type.description:
What triggers the tier to be valid for a customer.    
`IMMEDIATE`: After reaching minimum required points

expiration_date.description: Defines the conditions for the expiration date of a tier.

type.description: What triggers the tier to expire for a customer.

extend.description: Defines the amount of time the tier will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a tier with a duration of P3M will be valid for a duration of 3 months.

rounding.description: Defines the rounding mechanism for tier expiration.

type.description: Period to which the expiration will be rounded to.

strategy.description: Which portion of the period should the rounding be applied to.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the campaign.

8_obj_loyalty_card_object.title: Loyalty Card Object
8_obj_loyalty_card_object.description: This is an object representing a loyalty card.

examples.additional_info: This voucher discount is based on a formula, payment must be using VISA, and order must be over $100.

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher.

code.description: A code that identifies a voucher. Pattern can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters.

campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

campaign_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

category_id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Defines the type of voucher.

discount.description: Object representing discount parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `DISCOUNT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`.

gift.description: Object representing gift parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `GIFT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`.

loyalty_card.description: Object representing loyalty card parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `LOYALTY_CARD`.

points.description: Total points incurred over lifespan of loyalty card.

next_expiration_date.description: The next closest date when the next set of points are due to expire.

next_expiration_points.description: The amount of points that are set to expire next.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the code starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the code expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the voucher is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the voucher will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a voucher with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a voucher with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the voucher is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

assets.description: Stores links to images of QR and barcode that correspond to an encrypted voucher code.

qr.description: Stores Quick Response (QR) representation of encrypted code.

id.description: Encrypted voucher code ID.

url.description:
URL to QR code  

*Optional:* Attach query parameters to base URL to customize the image of the encrypted voucher code.  

- `size`: integer value from `1` to `100`  
- `format`: string, either `png` (default) or `svg`

barcode.description: Stores barcode representation of encrypted code.

id.description: Encrypted voucher code ID.

url.description:
URL to barcode  

*Optional:* Attach query parameters to base URL to customize the image of the encrypted voucher code.  

- `size`: integer value from `1` to `100`  
- `format`: string, either `png` (default) or `svg`

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

holder_id.description: Unique customer ID of voucher owner.

redemption.description: Stores a summary of redemptions that have been applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

redeemed_quantity.description: How many times a voucher has already been redeemed.

object.description: The type of object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the url attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of redemptions can be accessed using a GET method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/redemptions`

publish.description:
This object stores a summary of publish events: an events counter and an endpoint which can be called to return details of each event.  A publication is required for loyalty cards and referral codes. This object gets updated whenever a voucher has been published. Publication means assigning a code to a particular customer. Typically, a publication is made by distributing your codes to your customers, e.g. through Export to MailChimp or publish voucher API method. 

<!-- title: My Table Title -->

| Required | Optional |
| -------- | :------: |
| `type`:`LOYALTY_CARD` |  `type`:`DISCOUNT_VOUCHER`   | 
| `is_referral_code`:`true`      |    `type`:`GIFT_VOUCHER`   |

object.description: The type of object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the `url` attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of publications can be accessed using a GET method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/publications`

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. Default is `voucher`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

holder_id.description: Unique customer ID of voucher owner.

redemption.description: Stores a summary of redemptions that have been applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

redeemed_quantity.description: How many times a voucher has already been redeemed.

object.description: The type of object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the url attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of redemptions can be accessed using a GET method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/redemptions`

publish.description:
This object stores a summary of publish events: an events counter and an endpoint which can be called to return details of each event.  A publication is required for loyalty cards and referral codes. This object gets updated whenever a voucher has been published. Publication means assigning a code to a particular customer. Typically, a publication is made by distributing your codes to your customers, e.g. through Export to MailChimp or publish voucher API method. 

<!-- title: My Table Title -->

| Required | Optional |
| -------- | :------: |
| `type`:`LOYALTY_CARD` |  `type`:`DISCOUNT_VOUCHER`   | 
| `is_referral_code`:`true`      |    `type`:`GIFT_VOUCHER`   |

object.description: The type of object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the `url` attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of publications can be accessed using a GET method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/publications`

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. Default is `voucher`.

8_obj_earning_rule_object_copy.description: This is an object representing an earning rule.
8_obj_earning_rule_object_copy.title: Earning Rule Object

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the earning rule object.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the earning rule was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the earning rule was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

validation_rule_id.description: A unique validation rule identifier assigned by the Voucherify API. The validation rule is verified before points are added to the balance.

loyalty.description:
An object that defines the number of points that will be added to a loyalty card and how the points will be added.

- `FIXED` adds a fixed number of `points`
- `PROPORTIONAL` adds points proportionally based on a pre-defined ratio

points.description: The number of points to be added to the loyalty card.

type.description: Defines how the points will be added to the loyalty card. `FIXED` adds a fixed number of `points`.
Defines how the points will be added to the loyalty card.`PROPORTIONAL` adds points based on a pre-defined ratio

order.description: Defines proportion for calculating how many points to add to a loyalty card. The ratio is based on the order amount. For `every` dollar spent, the customer will get this many `points`.

amount.description: Defines the ratio based on the order amount.

every.description: Order amount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 order amount is written as 1000.

points.description: Number of points awarded.

custom_event.description: Contains the schema id of a custom event. **Required** for the custom event option in `event`.

schema_id.description: Contains a unique identifier of a custom event schema. Assigned by the Voucherify API.

segment.description: Contains the id of a customer segment. **Required** for the `customer.segment.entered` option in `event`.

id.description: Contains a unique identifier of a customer segment. Assigned by the Voucherify API.

event.description:
Defines the event which triggers the earning rule to add points to a loyalty card.  

- `order.paid` an event defined by the Voucherify API corresponding to an order status `PAID`. Read more here.  
- `customer.segment.entered` an event defined by the Voucherify API corresponding to a customer entering a pre-defined customer segment. Read more here.  
- `custom_event_name` the name of a custom event defined in the Dashboard → **Project Settings** → **EVENT SCHEMA** → **Add event definition**. Read more on defining custom events.

source.description: Contains the custom earning rule name and parent campaign.

banner.example: Order Paid - You will get 100 points
banner.description: Name of the earning rule. This is displayed as a header for the earning rule in the Dashboard.

object_id.description: A unique campaign identifier assigned by the Voucherify API.

object_type.description: Defines the object associated with the earning rule. Defaults to `campaign`.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the earning rule on or off. You can disable an earning rule even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date` of the campaign or the earning rule's own `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* earning rule
- `false` indicates an *inactive* earning rule

start_date.description: Start date defines when the earning rule starts to be active. Activation timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Earning rule is *inactive before* this date. If you don't define the start date for an earning rule, it'll inherit the campaign start date by default.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the earning rule expires. Expiration timestamp in ISO 8601 format.  Earning rule is *inactive after* this date.If you don't define the expiration date for an earning rule, it'll inherit the campaign expiration date by default.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the earning rule is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time an earning rule will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, an earning rule with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, an earning rule with an `interval` of `P2D` will be valid every other day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the earning rule is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. Default is `earning_rule`.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the earning rule is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time an earning rule will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, an earning rule with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, an earning rule with an `interval` of `P2D` will be valid every other day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the earning rule is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

8_obj_fixed_points.title: Define Fixed Amount of Points
8_obj_fixed_points.description: This is an object representing points calculated based on a fixed value.

points.description: The number of points to be added to the loyalty card.

type.description: Defines how the points will be added to the loyalty card. `FIXED` adds a fixed number of `points`.

8_obj_calculate_points_proportionally_or.title: Calculate Points Proportionally
8_obj_calculate_points_proportionally_or.description: This is an object representing points calculated proportionally to another property.

8_obj_calculate_points_proportionally_or.title: Calculate Points Proportionally to Order Amounts
8_obj_calculate_points_proportionally_or.description: This is an object representing points calculated proportionally to another property.

type.description: Defines how the points will be added to the loyalty card.`PROPORTIONAL` adds points based on a pre-defined ratio.

calculation_type.description:
- `ORDER_AMOUNT`: Pre-discount order amount (X points for every Y spent excluding discounts)
- `ORDER_TOTAL_AMOUNT`: Total order amount (X points for every Y spent including discount)

amount.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the `calculation_type` parameter. For every set of value (1, 10, etc) defined in the `every` parameter for the property defined in `calculation_type`, give the customer the number of points defined in the `points` parameter. In other words, for `every` `calculation_type`, give `points`.

every.description: Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 order amount is written as 1000.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

8_obj_calculate_points_proportionally_or.title: Calculate Points Proportionally To an Order Metadata Property
8_obj_calculate_points_proportionally_or.description: This is an object representing points calculated proportionally to an order metadata property.

type.description: Defines how the points will be added to the loyalty card.`PROPORTIONAL` adds points based on a pre-defined ratio.

calculation_type.description: `ORDER_METADATA`: Order Metadata (X points for every Y in metadata attribute, defined in the `property` key under the `order.metadata` object)

order.description: Defines the formula for calculating points proportionally.

metadata.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the `calculation_type` parameter. For every given increment of value (1, 10, etc) defined in the `every` parameter for the property defined in `calculation_type`, give the customer the number of points defined in the `points` parameter. In other words, for `every` order metadata property value, give `points`.

every.description: For how many increments of the order metadata property to grant points for.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

8_obj_calculate_points_proportionally_it.title: Calculate Points Proportionally to Order Items Amount
8_obj_calculate_points_proportionally_it.description: This is an object representing points calculated proportionally to another property.

type.description: Defines how the points will be added to the loyalty card.`PROPORTIONAL` adds points based on a pre-defined ratio.

calculation_type.description: - `ORDER_ITEMS_AMOUNT`; Pre-discount amount spent on items defined in the `order_items.amount.object` & `.id` (X points for every Y spent on items excluding discounts)

amount.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the `calculation_type` parameter. For every set of value (1, 10, etc) defined in the `every` parameter for the property defined in `calculation_type`, give the customer the number of points defined in the `points` parameter. In other words, for `every` `calculation_type`, give `points`.

every.description: Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 order amount is written as 1000.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

object.description: Type of object taken under consideration.

id.description: Unique ID of the resource, i.e. `pc_75U0dHlr7u75BJodrW1AE3t6`, `prod_0bae32322150fd0546`, or `sku_0b7d7dfb090be5c619`.

8_obj_calculate_points_proportionally_it.title: Calculate Points Proportionally to Order Items Subtotal Amount
8_obj_calculate_points_proportionally_it.description: This is an object representing points calculated proportionally to another property.

type.description: Defines how the points will be added to the loyalty card.`PROPORTIONAL` adds points based on a pre-defined ratio.

calculation_type.description: - `ORDER_ITEMS_SUBTOTAL_AMOUNT`; Amount spent on items defined in the `order_items.subtotal_amount.object` & `.id` (X points for every Y spent on items including discounts)

subtotal_amount.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the `calculation_type` parameter. For every set of value (1, 10, etc) defined in the `every` parameter for the property defined in `calculation_type`, give the customer the number of points defined in the `points` parameter. In other words, for `every` `calculation_type`, give `points`.

every.description: Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 order amount is written as 1000.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

object.description: Type of object taken under consideration.

id.description: Unique ID of the resource, i.e. `pc_75U0dHlr7u75BJodrW1AE3t6`, `prod_0bae32322150fd0546`, or `sku_0b7d7dfb090be5c619`.

8_obj_calculate_points_proportionally_cu.title: Calculate Points Proportionally To a Customer Metadata Property
8_obj_calculate_points_proportionally_cu.description: This is an object representing points calculated proportionally to a customer metadata property.

type.description: Defines how the points will be added to the loyalty card.`PROPORTIONAL` adds points based on a pre-defined ratio.

calculation_type.description: `CUSTOMER_METADATA`: Customer Metadata (X points for every Y in metadata attribute, defined in the `property` key under the `customer.metadata` object)

customer.description: Defines the formula for calculating points proportionally.

metadata.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the `calculation_type` parameter. For every given increment of value (1, 10, etc) defined in the `every` parameter for the property defined in `calculation_type`, give the customer the number of points defined in the `points` parameter. In other words, for `every` order metadata property value, give `points`.

every.description: For how many increments of the customer metadata property to grant points for.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

8_obj_calculate_points_proportionally_cu.title: Calculate Points Proportionally To a Custom Event Metadata Property
8_obj_calculate_points_proportionally_cu.description: This is an object representing points calculated proportionally to a custom event metadata property.

type.description: Defines how the points will be added to the loyalty card.`PROPORTIONAL` adds points based on a pre-defined ratio.

calculation_type.description: `CUSTOM_EVENT_METADATA`: Custom Event Metadata (X points for every Y in metadata attribute, defined in the `property` key under the `custom_event.metadata` object)

custom_event.description: Defines the formula for calculating points proportionally.

metadata.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the `calculation_type` parameter. For every given increment of value (1, 10, etc) defined in the `every` parameter for the property defined in `calculation_type`, give the customer the number of points defined in the `points` parameter. In other words, for `every` order metadata property value, give `points`.

every.description: For how many increments of the custom event metadata property to grant points for.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

This is an object representing a loyalty tier.  

Loyalty tiers are used to create a loyalty program with different levels of membership and varied earning rules and rewards based on customer’s tiers.

points.description:
Incremental balance to be added to/subtracted from the loyalty card.  

To add points: `100`  
To subtract points, add a minus: `-100`

expiration_date.description: Set expiration date for added points, i.e. `YYYY-MM-DD`. This parameter is **required** only when `expiration_type` is set to `CUSTOM_DATE`.

expiration_type.description:
Set the type of expiration for added points.  
- `PROGRAM_RULES`: Inherit rules from campaign.
- `NON_EXPIRING`: Points never expire.
- `CUSTOM_DATE`: Points expire on a particular date. **Requires** `expiration_date` parameter.

The merchant’s customer ID if it is different from the Voucherify customer ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a customer ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service. 

Please note that if you would like your data to sync based on the `source_id` of the customer, you need to define the `source_id` upfront. You will not be able to change or update the `source_id` later on.

description.description: An arbitrary string that you can attach to a customer object.

phone.description: Customer's phone number.  This parameter is mandatory when you try to send out codes to customers via an SMS channel.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. This metadata can be used for validating whether the customer qualifies for a discount or it can be used in building customer segments.

9_obj_customer_object.description:
This is an object representing a customer.  

This entity allows you to:
* store customer details in Voucherify
* link [redemptions](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/7_obj_redemption_object) and [validations](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/6_obj_validation_object) to a particular customer
* build customer segments and use them in validation rules.
9_obj_customer_object.title: Customer Object

id.description: The unique ID of a customer that is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant’s customer ID if it is different from the Voucherify customer ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a customer ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

description.description: An arbitrary string that you can attach to a customer object.

summary.description: Contains a summary of customer's redemption and order statistics.

total_redeemed.description: Total number of redemptions made by the customer.

total_failed.description: Total number of redemptions that failed.

total_succeeded.description: Total number of redemptions that succeeded.

total_rolled_back.description: Total number of redemptions that were rolled back for the customer.

total_rollback_failed.description: Total number of redemption rollbacks that failed.

total_rollback_succeeded.description: Total number of redemption rollbacks that succeeded.

redeemed_amount.description: Total amount of gift card credits redeemed by customer. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

amount_to_go.description: Remaining gift card balance across all gift cards. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

redeemed_points.description: Total number of loyalty points redeemed by the customer.

points_to_go.description: Sum of remaining available point balance accross all loyalty cards.

total_amount.description: The total amount spent by the customer. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

total_count.description: Total number of orders made by the customer.

average_amount.description: Average amount spent on orders. `total_amount` ÷ `total_count`. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

last_order_amount.description: Amount spent on last order. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

last_order_date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time of the customer's last order in ISO 8601 format.

referred_customers.description: Total number of customers referred by the customer.

campaigns.description: Contains campaigns with details about point balances and how many customers were referred by the customer.

campaign_name.description: Contains details about the point balances left on loyalty cards and the number of referred customers in each campaign.

points.description: Remaining point balance in campaign.

referred_customers.description: Number of customers referred by the customer in campaign.

referrals.description: Summary of customer's referrals, in this case, the customer being the referee, i.e. information about the source of referrals and number of times the customer was referred by other customers.

total.description: Total number of times this customer received a referral, i.e. was referred by another customer.

campaigns.description: Contains an array of campaigns that served as the source of a referral for the customer.

items.description: Contains information about the source of the referral.

campaign_id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

referrer_id.description: Unique referrer ID, assigned by Voucherify. This is the customer ID of a customer that is referring this customer.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer was referred in ISO 8601 format.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. This metadata can be used for validating whether the customer qualifies for a discount or it can be used in building customer segments.

system_metadata.description: Object used to store system metadata information.

consents.description: Stores a list of consent ID's along with the timestamp and decision on accepting or rejecting a marketing permission.

consentId.description: Unique ID of a consent, i.e. `cnst_lbgOBhHTuDrB7sjIhFjvIALj`.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when a consent was accepted or rejected in ISO 8601 format.

source.description: Takes on the name of the source of the integration if the customer was created through an integration, i.e. `Bigcommerce` or `Shopify`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer was updated in ISO 8601 format.

assets.description: Contains information about the customer's cockpit.

object.description: The type of object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the customer.
The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about customers in a dictionary.

9_obj_customer_activity_object.title: Customer Activity Object
9_obj_customer_activity_object.description:
This is an object representing customer activity.  

This is a general object which presents moments from customers' activity. There are all types of different events that customers perform during their journey once they participate in Promotions. Events describe moments when customers redeem coupons and earn points or rewards. The list of all types of activities is listed below.

The details describing the activity are collected in a property named `data`. In this object, software integrators will find all further information explaining the event context.  

Customer Activity Object is a type of [Event](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/15_obj_event_object)  which is our way of letting you know when something interesting happens in your project. When an interesting event concerning an individual customer occurs, we create a new Customer Activity object. For example, when a code is published to a customer, we create a `customer.publication.succeeded` event.

| **Event types (definition in progress)** |
|:---|
| customer.confirmed |
| customer.created |
| customer.updated |
| customer.deleted |
| customer.referred |
| customer.custom_event |
| customer.segment.entered |
| customer.segment.left |
| customer.sms.sent |
| customer.sms.failed |
| customer.email.sent |
| customer.email.failed |
| customer.activecampaign.sent |
| customer.activecampaign.failed |
| customer.braze.sent |
| customer.braze.failed |
| customer.mailchimp.sent |
| customer.mailchimp.failed |
| customer.intercom.sent |
| customer.intercom.failed |
| customer.rewarded |
| customer.rewarded.loyalty_points |
| customer.voucher.gift.balance_added |
| customer.voucher.loyalty_card.points_added |
| customer.voucher.loyalty_card.points_transferred |
| customer.publication.succeeded |
| customer.publication.failed |
| customer.redemption.succeeded |
| customer.redemption.failed |
| customer.redemption.rollback.succeeded |
| customer.redemption.rollback.failed |
| customer.consents.given |
| customer.consents.revoked |

id.description: Unique event ID, assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Event type.

data.description: Contains details about the event. The objects that are returned in the data attribute differ based on the context of the event type.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer activity occurred in ISO 8601 format.

id.description: Unique permanent deletion object ID.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer was requested to be deleted in ISO 8601 format.

related_object_id.description: Unique customer ID that is being deleted.

data_json.description: Statistics summarizing the number of related information that was deleted.

customer.description: Number of customers deleted.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON.

10_obj_order_object.title: Order object
10_obj_order_object.description:
This is an object representing an order.  

The purchase transactions can be tracked in Voucherify by the creation of an order object. You can create, retrieve, and pay individual orders, as well as list and export all of them in a CSV format. Orders are identified by a unique ID.

Orders are automatically created during the [redeem voucher](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1vouchers~1{code}~1redemption/post) and [redeem promotion](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1promotions~1tiers~1{promotion_tier_id}~1redemption/post) call.

<!-- theme: info -->
> #### order.id and order session
>
> If you use the same order.id in more than one redemption request, all valid discounts provided in the redemption payload will be applied to the given order.
> 
> Each time you use particular order in your requests, the API will automatically trigger a new session linked to the order.id. The session is active during the request and ends asynchronously after the request is completed. The session mechanism ensures that the particular order.id can be used in one API request at once.

id.description: Unique order ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant’s order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from CRM, database or 3rd party service.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was updated in ISO 8601 format.

amount.description: Order amount before applying any discount.

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order.

items_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied to the order.  
`sum(items, i => i.discount_amount)`

total_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied to the order.  
`total_discount_amount` = `discount_amount` + `items_discount_amount`

total_amount.description:
Order amount after applying all the discounts.  
`total_amount` = `amount` - `total_discount_amount`

items.description: Array of order items that have been applied to the order. Each order item can show the effects of particular discounts on the item-level.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the order item.

product_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

sku_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

quantity.description: Quantity of the item in the cart.

amount.description: Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`).

discount_amount.description: The item-level discount applied to the item.

price.description: Unit price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

subtotal_amount.description:
Final order item amount after the applied item-level discount.  If there are no item-level discounts applied, this item is equal to the `amount`.   
`subtotal_amount`=`amount`-`discount_amount`

product.description: This object stores more information about the related product.

override.description: The override set to true is used to store the product information in the system. If product does not exist, it will be created with the use of `source_id`; if it does exist, the provided values for the `name`, `price`, and `metadata` will replace those already stored in the system.

10_req_orders_order_item_sku.title: SKU
10_req_orders_order_item_sku.description: An object containing details of the related SKU.

source_id.description: The merchant’s SKU ID (if it is different than Voucherify's SKU ID). It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce site, a database or a 3rd party service.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to an SKU. It can be useful for storing additional information about the SKU in a structured format.

override.description: The override is used to store the SKU in the system. If the SKU does not exist, it will be created with the use of `source_id`. Additionally, if the SKU does not exist, you are required to set the parent `product_id` that it belongs to. Set the parent `product_id` one level above, i.e. at the item level. If the parent product does not exist in Voucherify, i.e. does not have a unique `product_id`, then define the product object one level above, i.e. at the item level and make sure to also include the override as `true` for the product.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the order item.

sku_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

quantity.description: Quantity of the item in the cart.

amount.description: Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`).

discount_amount.description: The item-level discount applied to the item.

price.description: Unit price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

subtotal_amount.description:
Final order item amount after the applied item-level discount.  If there are no item-level discounts applied, this item is equal to the `amount`.   
`subtotal_amount`=`amount`-`discount_amount`

product.description: This object stores more information about the related product.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique product identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price of a product. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

sku.description: This object stores more information about the related SKU.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique SKU identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price of a SKU. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

10_obj_order_item_object.description:
This is an object representing an order item.  

Order Items are always specified within [the order object](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/10_obj_order_object). They can be related either to [products](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/11_obj_product_object) or [SKUs](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/11_obj_sku_object).  

Product/SKU details sent within an order item will be used on top of Product/SKU already stored in the system during the [Redeem Voucher](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1vouchers~1{code}~1redemption/post), [Validate Voucher](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1vouchers~1{code}~1validate), [Validate Promotions](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1promotions~1validation) and [Redeem Promotion](ref:redeem-promotion) requests.

11_obj_product_object.description:
This is an object representing a product.  

This entity should be used to map product items from your inventory management system. The aim of products is to build  validation rules which reflect product-specific campaigns.
11_obj_product_object.title: Product Object

id.description: Unique product ID.

source_id.description: Unique product source ID from your inventory system.

price.description: Product unit price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

attributes.description: A list of product attributes whose values you can customize for given SKUs: `["color","size","ranking"]`. Each child SKU can have a unique value for a given attribute.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the product. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a product object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the product in a structured format.

image_url.description: The HTTPS URL pointing to the .png or .jpg file that will be used to render the product image.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the product was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the product was updated in ISO 8601 format.

11_obj_sku_object.title: SKU Object
11_obj_sku_object.description:
This is an object representing a product SKU.  

The SKU (acronym from Stock Keeping Unit) is tightly related to [the product object](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/11_obj_product_object). It reflects its different variants. One product can have many SKUs which are characterised and differentiated by varying values of the parent product `attributes`.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique SKU identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: SKU unit price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

attributes.description: The attributes object stores values for all custom attributes inherited by the SKU from the parent product. A set of key/value pairs that are attached to a SKU object and are unique to each SKU within a product family.

image_url.description: The HTTPS URL pointing to the .png or .jpg file that will be used to render the SKU image.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the SKU. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a SKU object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the SKU in a structured format.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the SKU was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the SKU was updated in ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the SKU.

12_obj_product_collection_object.title: Product Collection Object
12_obj_product_collection_object.description:
This is an object representing a product collection.  

The products can be grouped into collections by the creation of a products collection object. You can retrieve a product collection and a list of products in the collection. Product collections are identified by a unique ID.

data.name: Dynamic - DVDs and socks - API POST

13_obj_validation_rule_object.title: Validation Rule Object
13_obj_validation_rule_object.description:
This is an object representing a validation rule.  

This entity stores the rules used to limit resources in Voucherify. The validation rule can be assigned to resources such as a:  
- [voucher](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/1_obj_voucher_object)
- [campaign](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/2_obj_campaign_object)
- [earning rule](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/8_obj_earning_rule_object)
- [reward assignment](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/4_obj_reward_assignment_object)
- [promotion tier](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/3_obj_promotion_tier_object)
- [distribution](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/5_obj_publication_object)

You can configure the Validation Rule to include your own custom error messages which are going to be returned from the API upon a validation / redemption failure. You can read more [here](../docs/introduction/Errors.md#custom-error-messages-with-Validation-Rules).

id.description: Unique validation rule ID.

name.description: Custom, unique name for set of validation rules.

rules.description: Contains all the rule definitions for the validation rule. It is a set of key value pairs representing the rules and logic between the rules. The keys are numbered consequtively beginning from `1`. The values are objects containing the rule conditions.
